options.content:
- Use Cases: This dashboard shows the basic Git and Code Review metrics from GitHub.
- Data Source Required: GitHub

panels.title: Dashboard Introduction
1. User Requirements (Issues)

targets.rawSql:
select 
	count(distinct i.id)
from 
	issues i
	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
where
  $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
  and b.id in ($repo_id)

panels.title: 1.1 Number of New Issues [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
with _issues as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(i.created_date), INTERVAL -DAY(date(i.created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct i.id) as issue_count
  FROM issues i
  	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
  	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
    and i.created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and b.id in ($repo_id)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  date_format(time,'%M %Y') as month,
  issue_count as "Issue Count"
FROM _issues
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 1.2 Number of New Issues [Each Month]
2. How issues are handled?

targets.rawSql:
select 
	count(distinct i.id)
from 
	issues i
	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
where
  $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
  and b.id in ($repo_id)
  and i.status = "DONE"

panels.title: 2.1 Number of Closed Issues [Issues Created in Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  DATE_ADD(date(i.created_date), INTERVAL -DAYOFMONTH(date(i.created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
  count(distinct case when status != 'DONE' then i.id else null end) as open_issue_count,
  count(distinct case when status = 'DONE' then i.id else null end) as closed_issue_count
FROM issues i
	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
  and i.created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  and b.id in ($repo_id)
group by 1

panels.title: 2.2 Number of Open and Closed Issues [Issues Created in Each Month]

targets.rawSql:
select 
	AVG(i.lead_time_minutes/1440) issue_lead_time_in_days
from 
	issues i
	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
where
  $__timeFilter(i.resolution_date)
  and i.resolution_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  and b.id in ($repo_id)
  and i.status = "DONE"

panels.title: 2.3 Mean Issue Lead Time in Days [Issues Closed in Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
with _issues as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(i.resolution_date), INTERVAL -DAY(date(i.resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    AVG(i.lead_time_minutes/1440) as issue_lead_time
  FROM issues i
  	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
  	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
  WHERE
    b.id in ($repo_id)
    and i.status = "DONE"
    and $__timeFilter(i.resolution_date)
    and i.resolution_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  date_format(time,'%M %Y') as month,
  issue_lead_time as "Mean Issue Lead Time in Days"
FROM _issues
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 2.4 Mean Issue Lead Time in Days [Issues Closed in Each Month]

targets.rawSql:
-- Get the queue time of all outstanding bugs
with _outstanding_issues as(
  select 
    b.name as repo_name,
    i.issue_key as issue_key,
    i.title,
    i.created_date,
    (TIMESTAMPDIFF(MINUTE, i.created_date,NOW()))/1440 as queue_time_in_days,
    concat(b.url,'/',i.issue_key) as url
  from 
    issues i
    left join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
    left join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
  where
    b.id in ($repo_id)
    and $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
    and i.status != 'DONE'
)

select title, queue_time_in_days from _outstanding_issues
order by 2 desc

panels.title: 2.5 Queue Time in Days [All Open Issues]

targets.rawSql:
-- Get the queue time of all outstanding bugs
select 
  b.name as repo_name,
  i.issue_key as issue_key,
  i.title,
  i.created_date,
  (TIMESTAMPDIFF(MINUTE, i.created_date,NOW()))/1440 as queue_time_in_days,
  concat(b.url,'/',i.issue_key) as url
from 
  issues i
  left join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
  left join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
where
  b.id in ($repo_id)
  and $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
  and i.status != 'DONE'
order by queue_time_in_days desc

panels.title: 2.6 List of Outstanding Issues Order By Queue Time [All Open Issues]
3. Contribution (PRs)

targets.rawSql:
select
	count(*) as pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)

panels.title: 3.1 Number of New Pull Requests [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAY(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(*) as pr_count
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    base_repo_id in ($repo_id)
    and $__timeFilter(created_date)
    and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  date_format(time,'%M %Y') as month,
  pr_count as "Pull Request Count"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 3.2 Total Number of New Pull Requests [Each Month]

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
  author_name,
	count(*) as merged_pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)
  and pr.status = 'MERGED'
group by 1
order by 2 desc
limit 20

panels.title: 3.3 Top Contributors By Merged PRs
4. How PRs are handled?

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
  count(distinct case when status = 'MERGED' then id else null end)/count(distinct case when status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED') then id else null end) as ratio
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)

panels.title: 4.1 Ratio of Non-merging Pull Requests of All Closed PRs

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
SELECT
  DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAYOFMONTH(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
  count(distinct case when status = 'OPEN' then id else null end) as "PR: Open",
  count(distinct case when status = 'CLOSED' then id else null end) as "PR: Closed without merging",
  count(distinct case when status = 'MERGED' then id else null end) as "PR: Closed and merged"
FROM pull_requests
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
  and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)
group by 1

panels.title: 4.2 Pull Request Status Distribution [Each Month]

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
	count(*) as merged_pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)
	and pr.status = 'CLOSED'

panels.title: 4.3 Number of Pull Requests Closed without Merging [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
SELECT
  DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAYOFMONTH(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
  count(distinct case when status = 'CLOSED' then id else null end)/count(distinct case when status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED') then id else null end) as ratio
FROM pull_requests
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
  and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)
group by 1

panels.title: 4.4 Ratio of Non-merging Pull Requests of All Closed PRs [Each Month]

targets.rawSql:
select
	avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,merged_date)/1440)
from 
	pull_requests
where 
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)
	and merged_date is not null

panels.title: 4.5 Mean Time to Merge of Pull Requests in Days [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAY(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,merged_date)/1440) as time_to_merge
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(created_date)
    and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  date_format(time,'%M %Y') as month,
  time_to_merge as "Time to Merge"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 4.6 Mean Time to Merge of Pull Requests in Days [Each Month]

targets.rawSql:
select
	avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,closed_date)/1440) as time_to_close
from 
	pull_requests
where 
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)
	and status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED')

panels.title: 4.7 Mean Time to Close of Pull Requests in Days [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAY(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,closed_date)/1440) as time_to_close
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(created_date)
    and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and base_repo_id in ($repo_id)
    and status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED')
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  date_format(time,'%M %Y') as month,
  time_to_close as "Time to Close"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 4.8 Mean Time to Close of Pull Requests in Days [Each Month]

options.content: This dashboard is created based on this [data schema](https://devlake.apache.org/docs/DataModels/DevLakeDomainLayerSchema). Want to add more metrics? Please follow the [guide](https://devlake.apache.org/docs/Configuration/Dashboards/GrafanaUserGuide).

list.definition: select concat(name, '--', id) as text from repos where id like 'github%'
list.label: Repo
list.name: repo_id
list.query: select concat(name, '--', id) as text from repos where id like 'github%'
